tropeNotes: [Body to Jewel](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BodyToJewel): She sheds a crystal tear which Snow keeps with him for the duration of the game.

[The Cassandra](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheCassandra): Her explanations about being branded a l'Cie is dismissed by Lightning, but it eventually [turns out to be true](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CassandraTruth) when Serah gets captured.
[The Cutie](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheCutie): A sweet girl and Snow's fiancée.
[Damsel in Distress](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DamselInDistress): She's captured by Anima, forcing both of her protectors (Lightning and Snow) to follow her in a rescue attempt.

[Demoted to Extra](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DemotedToExtra): She was originally meant to be the seventh party member, but problems with her implementation led to her being made an NPC, which resulted in Lightning's more serious personality and Fang's [Gender Flip](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GenderFlip).

[Deuteragonist](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Deuteragonist): When the *XIII* trilogy is looked at as a whole, it's a story about Lightning and Serah, and their journey across time and space to find each other again.
[Disney Death](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DisneyDeath): Lightning treats her crystallization as death, but it's later revealed that l'Cie can be unfrozen.
[Hero of Another Story](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HeroOfAnotherStory): She is the protagonist of the sequel *XIII-2*.
[Huge Guy, Tiny Girl](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HugeGuyTinyGirl): She is fairly average in height but anyone would look tiny next to [Snow](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheBigGuy).
[Feminine Women Can Cook](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FeminineWomenCanCook): Between Lightning and Serah, Serah is the better cook.
[The Lost Lenore](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheLostLenore): For Snow, as the comatose lover that he feels both inspired and tormented by.

[Morality Pet](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MoralityPet): She is the very reason why Lightning gladly joins the Guardian Corps and raises her after their [parent's death](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ParentalAbandonment). Not only that Lightning also blows up a train, decimates a military unit, hijacks equipment to break into an ancient temple, and takes on a god-like being to rescue her. Lightning even falls to a [Heroic BSoD](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HeroicBSOD) when she turns into a crystal believing that she's dead.

[Parental Marriage Veto](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ParentalMarriageVeto): Rather from the parental substitute. Lightning is *so* opposed to it that she thinks "I'm a l'Cie" is something Serah and Snow *made up* so that she would approve of their engagement. Unfortunately, that was the one time Lightning really should have listened to Serah.

[Posthumous Character](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PosthumousCharacter):
    - (SPOILER) Subverted; she is largely developed as such, but crystallized l'Cie are indeed [Not Quite Dead](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NotQuiteDead), and she's revived along with Dajh during the ending. - (SPOILER) Played straight in *Lightning Returns*, where she is dead from the previous game but still affects the setting in memory..
[Rose-Haired Sweetie](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RoseHairedSweetie): A cheerful and big-hearted girl who's a [Foil](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Foil) to her stoic soldier sister.
[You Are Worth Hell](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/YouAreWorthHell): Snow firmly believes she is and she's grateful.
[Action Girl](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ActionGirl): [Believe it or not](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TookALevelInBadass) she kicks a substantial amount of ass as the game's heroine.
[Apologetic Attacker](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ApologeticAttacker): She sometimes apologies this after killing an enemy because she's more outwardly caring than her sister.
[Ascended Extra](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AscendedExtra): Downplayed, but present: she goes from supporting character in *XIII* to playable character and heroine in this game.

[Badass Adorable](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BadassAdorable): Possesses fighting skills on-par with the original party members now, but she's no less cute while doing it. Her victory pose is catching [Mog](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EmpathicWeapon) and giving him a hug. Aaaaaaw.
[Badass Teacher](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BadassTeacher): She scolds a school of miniflan into submission.

[The Beastmaster](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheBeastmaster): As with Lightning, she can collect crystals of monsters and raise them akin to *Pokémon*, the datalog explains this is a lesser form of [Summon Magic](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SummonMagic).
[Beware the Nice Ones](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BewareTheNiceOnes): Among her students she has a reputation as a strict teacher and both Snow and Noel comment she is like Lightning when she is angry.

[Black Mage](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BlackMage): Serah specializes in the [Ravager](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ElementalPowers), [Sentinel](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/StoneWall) and [Saboteur](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/StatusEffects) [paradigms](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/StanceSystem).
[Bow and Sword in Accord](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BowAndSwordInAccord): They're technically the same weapon, but the effect remains.

[Crazy Cat Lady](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CrazyCatLady): Some of her Live Triggers can invoke this, regarding her cat [Snow](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WeNamedTheMonkeyJack). [Because the cat is her only family!](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MemeticMutation)
[Cool Sword](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CoolSword): A shapeshifted Moogle that can also [turn into a bow](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MixAndMatchWeapon)

[Combat Pragmatist](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CombatPragmatist): One of her specialities is sabotaging the enemy to give herself an advantage. When a monster is staggered, she shouts "Go! Go! Go!" to make sure her teammates hit them harder.
[Cute Clumsy Girl](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CuteClumsyGirl): Not always noticeable, but she dashes her knee every time she comes out of a gate.
[Dreaming of Things to Come](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DreamingOfThingsToCome): Saw Noel in her dreams before she met him.

[Elemental Powers](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ElementalPowers): As a [Ravager](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BlackMage), she learns all of the [fire](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PlayingWithFire) and [lightning](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ShockAndAwe) spells.
[Empathic Weapon](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EmpathicWeapon): Mog [transforms](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EquippableAlly) into both her sword and bow, and only does this for her.
[Energy Bow](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/EnergyBow): Sort of, it fires physical arrows that don't exist till after they've been fired.

[Fangirl](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Fangirl): Of Snow. Best demonstrated in an optional Live Trigger where Noel asks her what Snow means to her where she goes into a rapid rant about how awesome he is as seen [here.](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ywMHnJJ-KpM)

[Gameplay and Story Segregation](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GameplayAndStorySegregation): Although she has never fought before in her life, she is just as useful as Noel, who has been fighting monsters all his life, from battle one. However, it was mentioned that she learned how to defend herself, which makes sense as she and the people of Bodhum chose to go off into the wilds of Pulse in search of a beach. Being a teacher by profession instead of a hunter, it doesn't come up as often.
[Girly Run](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GirlyRun): Her manner of running is quite the contrast with her tomboyish older sister.

[Guys Smash, Girls Shoot](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GuysSmashGirlsShoot): The developers have stated they wanted Serah's sword to turn into a bow to preserve her femininity. Unlike Noel and Lightning, her weapon actively maintains its ranged form rather than taking it situationally, and Starseeker's appearances outside of *XIII-2* are always as a bow.
[The Heroine](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheHeroine): *XIII-2* is her story of tracking her sister through her time and helping people along the way.
[The Hero Dies](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheHeroDies):  (SPOILER) During the ending, she has a vision that kills her.
[Hotter and Sexier](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HotterAndSexier): Many of her outfits are skimpier than before.

[I Regret Nothing](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/IRegretNothing): Even when she discovers that  (SPOILER)  changing the future will eventually kill her , Serah remains unwavering and continues on her journey. Later  (SPOILER)  after her death  she reappears to Lightning and says she had no regrets because she made a promise to keep going on until they were reunited.
[Mage Marksman](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MageMarksman): Her specialty is magic but is also skilled at archery and [swordplay](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MagicKnight).

[Ms. Fanservice](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MsFanservice): Her standard combat outfit shows off her shoulders, and very nearly her midriff. Not to mention that an available DLC outfit has her in nothing but a bikini.

[Muscles Are Meaningless](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MusclesAreMeaningless): As any real-world archer will tell you, it takes a decent amount of strength and stamina to pull a bowstring properly and effectively enough to use it as a weapon. Serah's arms don't look muscular in the slightest. However, [The "bow" is just Mog shapeshifted.](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FridgeBrilliance) It's likely Mog is helping her operate him as a bow effectively. Also, look at how the bow is constructed, it has more in common with a NERF bow blaster than a traditional bow. The trope is lampshaded on the Archylte Steppe, where passing one of the hunters as Serah will earn the comment that "There's a lot of strength in those skinny arms."

["No More Holding Back" Speech](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NoMoreHoldingBackSpeech): Delivers one to Caius
QUOTE  **Serah**: "I know the truth, Caius.  (SPOILER)  I know that every time I change things, I lose a part of my life.  But don't you see? I don't care. I'm here to protect the future. And I will.
[Pink Girl, Blue Boy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PinkGirlBlueBoy): Pink to Noel's blue.
[Platonic Life-Partners](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PlatonicLifePartners): With Noel. They become very close over the course of the game but they have love interests in other people.
[The Power of Love](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ThePowerOfLove): Serah takes out several miniflans that were attacking Snow with no weapon whatsoever.
[Promoted to Playable](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PromotedToPlayable): From an NPC in the original game to the main protagonist of *XIII-2*.
[Rain of Arrows](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RainOfArrows): With her Ultima Arrow skill.

[Rule of Cool](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RuleOfCool): Mog's "bow" form is some chaotic hybrid of a proper bow and a crossbow's propulsion mechanism; rather than a bowstring, it has a long chamber into which the arrows are loaded before firing <sup>note </sup>  By "loaded" we mean "materialized", but ignore that for a moment . That would be horrendously impractical *and* easily ruined for any physical weapon; combined with the fact that it must be assumed the weapon is spring-loaded or something in order to give it any propulsion at *all*, which would be significantly weaker than a proper longbow, and Rule of Cool (or [A Wizard Did It](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/AWizardDidIt)) is the only excuse the weapon has for its design.
[Sacred Bow and Arrows](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SacredBowAndArrows): Her Ultima Arrow skill, which was "Artemis Arrow" in the Japanese release.

[Seers](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Seers) She possesses the "Eyes of Etro" which enable her to see the future.  (SPOILER)  This is [Blessed with Suck](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BlessedWithSuck) because it eats up her life span.
[Silk Hiding Steel](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SilkHidingSteel): In the words of Noel she is an "angel hiding an ogre."

[The Straight and Arrow Path](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheStraightAndArrowPath): Many of the time periods she visits have guns as commonplace but she uses a bow. Justified as her bow is [not a normal bow](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MorphWeapon) and her archery specific skills wouldn't work with a gun.
[Stern Teacher](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SternTeacher): Her students in New Bodhum call her "Meanie Miss Farron."
[Stripperific](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Stripperific): Her outfit in *XIII-2* shows significantly more skin than her one in *XIII-1*.
[Swiss-Army Weapon](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SwissArmyWeapon): Mog, which can transform into a sword or bow.

[Three-Point Landing](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ThreePointLanding): The time gates deposit her and Noel in midair; Serah tends to land like this. At least once she has too much momentum and bangs her knee on the ground beneath her.

[Took a Level in Badass](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TookALevelInBadass): From [Damsel in Distress](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DamselInDistress) in the original game and at game open to full-blown [Action Girl](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ActionGirl) by Chapter 2.
[Transhuman](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Transhuman): After the fall of Cocoon, Serah is one of the few who have developed natural magical abilities; by Noel's time this is said to be the norm.

TvTName: Tropes present only in Lightning Returns
tropeNotes: [Back from the Dead](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BackFromTheDead): This is what Lightning is trying to achieve by working with Bhunivelze.  (SPOILER)  Bhunivelze can't bring her back but she is brought back to life anyway towards the end of the game when Sazh is able to find her soul, allowing everyone to be brought into the new world, Serah included.

TvTName: Tropes present only in Lightning Returns
tropeNotes: [Becoming the Mask](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BecomingTheMask):  (SPOILER) She may be a fake, but she states at the end that her attempt to think and act like the real Serah caused her to come to love Lightning as an older sister for real.

TvTName: Tropes present only in Lightning Returns
tropeNotes: [Break Them by Talking](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BreakThemByTalking): When Lightning refuses to be honest in the end and keeps trying to justify  (SPOILER) becoming the new Goddess of Death, the fake Serah then reveals to Lightning that Lumina is the manifestation of all the weaknesses she forcibly tore away from herself when she was young, then tells her she deserves to be abandoned in the Chaos forever. This is what spurs Lightning to cry out for help.

TvTName: Tropes present only in Lightning Returns
tropeNotes: [Clone Angst](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CloneAngst):  (SPOILER) The "Serah" that talks to Lightning whenever she returns to the Ark is a fake that was created by Bhunivelze. At the end of the game, she expresses regret that she is not real and can only emulate what she believes the real Serah would say and do .

TvTName: Tropes present only in Lightning Returns
tropeNotes: [Death is Cheap](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DeathIsCheap): The real Serah  (SPOILER)  died in *XIII-2*, but is back by the end of LR, and is in college in the new world .

TvTName: Tropes present only in Lightning Returns
tropeNotes: [Killed Off for Real](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/KilledOffForReal):  (SPOILER) *Nothing* can bring her back, not even the power of a god. The best Bhunivelze can do is create an imperfect, defective clone of her. However, she is [brought back anyway thanks to Lightning,](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TakeAThirdOption) when she brings all the souls over to the new world.

TvTName: Tropes present only in Lightning Returns
tropeNotes: [Go Out with a Smile](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GoOutWithASmile):  (SPOILER) The last thing the fake does before vanishing forever is to tell Lightning she loves her .

TvTName: Tropes present only in Lightning Returns
tropeNotes: [Walking Spoiler](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WalkingSpoiler): Partly due to the fact that she  (SPOILER) truly died in the previous game and the one presented here is a fake created by Bhunivelze .
[Action Girl](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ActionGirl): Lebreau carries around a rifle and is unafraid to shoot anything from Bodhum's local monsters to Cocoon's anti-Pulse task force.

[Artistic License – Gun Safety](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ArtisticLicenseGunSafety): They tend to walk around New Bodhum with their fingers on the triggers, even when they're standing in front of (or *in*) a crowd of civilians (many of whom are armed and holding their guns similarly).
[The Bartender](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheBartender): Lebeau ran a bar in Bodhum prior to the events of *XIII*, and has opened a new one in New Bodhum by *XIII-2*.

[The Cavalry](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheCavalry):  (SPOILER) The whole team in Chapter 12 arrives to help the heroes. Triples as a Crowning Moment of Awesome *and* a Crowning moment of Heartwarming when they tell Snow that they don't care whether or not he's a l'Cie, they're still a team to the end.
[Expy](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Expy): Of [Avalanche](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/VideoGame/FinalFantasyVII)
[Face of a Thug](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FaceOfAThug): A kid in New Bodhum observes that Gadot "acts nice, but his face is all mean".

[The Fashionista](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheFashionista): Yuj is a fashion-minded individual. Live Triggers in *XIII-2* reveal that he's always seen in a fanciful outfit because that's his *normal* outfit, and has apparently had a few cases where he can't resist trying on a new outfit right before bed and so wakes up in nice clothes without remembering putting them on.
[Guest-Star Party Member](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GuestStarPartyMember): Lebreau and Gadot serve as Snow's party in the first chapter, before he heads to Pulse Vestige.

[Goggles Do Nothing](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GogglesDoNothing): Maqui wears a pair of goggles that look to be of the workman type. As we never see him *in* his workshop, they're always sitting on his forehead.

[Mad Libs Catchphrase](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MadLibsCatchphrase): "[Enemy] is/are no match for NORA!" It's implied that before the events of *XIII*, it was "monsters"; by the time we join them in the Hanging Edge, it's "[the army](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LaResistance)"; and  (SPOILER) when they show up for moral support in Chapter 12, it's "[fal'Cie](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DidYouJustPunchOutCthulhu)".
[Mr. Fixit](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MrFixit): Maqui is in charge of fixing the group's gear.
[One of the Boys](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OneOfTheBoys): Lebreau has a tougher attitude than Maqui and Yuj do.
[Sleeves Are for Wimps](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SleevesAreForWimps): Gadot wears a sleeveless top in order to show off some of the most muscle-bound arms in the series.
[Small Girl, Big Gun](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SmallGirlBigGun): All of Team Nora uses the standard military issue machine gun except for Lebreau who packs a much larger rifle.
[Stripperific](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Stripperific): Lebreau's outfit is based on volleyball players.
[Team Chef](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TeamChef): Lebreau runs the bar/diner in NORA House, and a Live Trigger in *XIII-2* has her insist that *instincts* are the most important part of cooking.
[Team Mom](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TeamMom): Lebreau.

[Theme Naming](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ThemeNaming): Doubles as [Fridge Brilliance](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FridgeBrilliance), as Snow and the two [Guest Star Party Members](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GuestStarPartyMember) Lebreau and Gadot all have rhyming names.

[Back for the Finale](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BackForTheFinale): In both *XIII-2* and *Lightning Returns*, along with his father. *XIII-2* has him  (SPOILER) playing emotional support when Sazh pilots and airship to pursue Chaos Bahamut , and *Lightning Returns* has him and Sazh  (SPOILER) going to find Serah's soul during the Apocalypse.

[Cheerful Child](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/CheerfulChild): Unlike his dad, he is truly happy throughout the game because he is ignorant of the death going on. He's also kept by PSICOM so he's not fighting monsters.
[Convenient Coma](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ConvenientComa): Has been in one for 500 years when *Lightning Returns* takes place.

[Disney Death](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DisneyDeath): In *XIII*, he's branded by a Sanctum fal'Cie and successfully completes his Focus. L'Cie crystallization is a semi-permanent coma, not death, but Sazh's reaction to his son entering stasis would not look out of place with a corpse instead of a crystal.
[Our Souls Are Different](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OurSoulsAreDifferent): His soul got split into 5 fragments and scattered across Nova Chrysalia after he fell into his coma.
[The Conscience](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheConscience): Talks Sazh out of  (SPOILER) killing himself  multiple times.
[Head Pet](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/HeadPet): Resides in Sazh's [Funny Afro](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/FunnyAfro).

[Intellectual Animal](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/IntellectualAnimal): She can communicate with Sazh somehow and clearly recognizes when  (SPOILER) a human is about to kill themselves or when they need help in battle .
[Killer Rabbit](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/KillerRabbit): Her entry in the Datalog implies it. The fact that it took on an  (SPOILER) armed PSICOM soldier  and won confirms it.

[No Name Given](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NoNameGiven):
    - The chick is unnamed. The implication is that Sazh wants Dajh to have the honor of naming it. In Episode Zero, Sazh declares that he'll give it a name "as soon as they get back" and wants to give it a "cool, cute name". - In *XIII-2*, (SPOILER) Dajh named her Chocolina, as it turned out she was a girl. Yes, the same name as the merchant.

[Not Allowed to Grow Up](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/NotAllowedToGrowUp): Chocobos are described as growing up too fast to be long-term pets, with most of the chocobos in Nautilus being kids' presents that outgrew the kids they were gifted to. This little one manages to remain a chick throughout the entirety of *XIII*, and up to the point where she and Sazh got separated in *XIII-2* <sup>* </sup>  It's not made clear what year Sazh and Dajh encountered the temporal anomaly that took them to Serendipity, but he'd been flying passenger airships long enough for Hope to have heard about it second-hand.  Beyond that point, it's arguably justified, as  (SPOILER) she's been blessed by Etro with time-traveling and shape-shifting powers.

[Precision F-Strike](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PrecisionFStrike):
QUOTE **Sazh:** "Hurry the *what* up?"
[Ridiculously Cute Critter](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RidiculouslyCuteCritter): It's a baby Chocobo.
[Team Pet](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TeamPet): He's Sazh's pet (or rather Dajh's) and travels with the group.
[Action Mom](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ActionMom): She volunteers for Snow's militia and even saves Snow at one point.
[Color-Coded Characters](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ColorCodedCharacters): Like Hope, she has a green motif.
[Deceased Parents Are the Best](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DeceasedParentsAreTheBest): As far as what we see in the game alone, she was a very loving mother to Hope.
[Living Emotional Crutch](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/LivingEmotionalCrutch): Hope looked up to her more than he did to his own father.
[Mama Bear](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/MamaBear): She covers for her son and  (SPOILER) goes out with a bang by virtue of saving Snow's ass with a bazooka .
[Plot-Triggering Death](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/PlotTriggeringDeath): Had she not died, Hope would have never gotten mixed up with the main party.
[Sacrificial Lamb](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/SacrificialLamb): She's a minor character that dies in the prologue.

[Bumbling Dad](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BumblingDad): Every appearance or mention he makes reinforces the notion that he cannot make Hope happy. [Word of God](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WordOfGod) states that he is clumsy at expressing his love for his wife and son.

[Control Freak](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/ControlFreak): He's clearly somewhat domineering and controlling towards Hope, but for a good reason, especially when he continues to defy him now that he (Hope) is a l'Cie.
[Demoted to Extra](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/DemotedToExtra): In the sequels.

[Fiction 500](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Fiction500): He and his family are implied to be well-endowed, but being a Sanctum official certainly makes him one of the wealthiest people on Cocoon. He, his wife and his son live in Felix Heights, which were the most expensive suburbs that Palumpolum had to offer.

[Oh, Crap!](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OhCrap): When Hope explains to his father that he is now a l'Cie, Bartholomew immediately takes the situation seriously and tries to see to it that Hope and his friends are out of PSICOM's clutches.
[Rich Bastard](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/RichBastard): Averted. He cares for Hope, his wife and their friends.

[What Happened to the Mouse?](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WhatHappenedToTheMouse): Bartholomew helps the main party escape, but he is not seen again afterwards and the only mention made as to what happened to him is from Hope explaining that he was rescued by the Calvary. He does, however appear in the sequel novel and in *XIII-3* as a very brief cameo.

[Why Couldn't You Be Different?](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WhyCouldntYouBeDifferent) / [When You Coming Home, Dad?](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/WhenYouComingHomeDad): Hope can't understand why his father's work is more important than him or his mother.
[Workaholic](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/Workaholic): His relationship with Hope is strained due to his job.
[Badass Longrobe](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BadassLongrobe): Wears a white longrobe, is the Primarch of Cocoon  (SPOILER) and a fal'Cie called Barthandelus .

[Badass Boast](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/BadassBoast): Combines this with ["The Reason You Suck" Speech](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/TheReasonYouSuckSpeech), making for a truly awe-inspiring monologue when (SPOILER) [reveals his true nature to the heroes](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=H3UT8g3jQG0he) when they confront him for the first time . The [Oh, Crap!](/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/OhCrap) looks on the faces of the party are amazing. QUOTE " (SPOILER) I am fal'Cie. My name is Barthandelus; voice of the Sanctum, and Lord-Sovereign of the Cocoon fal'Cie. Your kind feared the darkness, so we gave you light. You begged us for the Purge, and did it not come to pass? Now you spurn our counsel? You must learn your place! "
